title: U.S.: Citi Delivers for Three Square Food Bank
summary: Las Vegas, Nev. – Citi volunteers joined forces in late September to give back to the Las Vegas community, contributing 540 service-hours at Three Square Food Bank to sort and pack food for needy individuals and families. In one afternoon, Citi employees sorted more than 80,000 pounds of perishable and non-perishable food items and packed 2,415 backpack meals for children who may otherwise go without food on the weekends.
tag-1: U.S.: Citi Delivers for Three Square Food Bank
tag-3: Las Vegas, Nev. – Citi volunteers joined forces in late September to give back to the Las Vegas community, contributing 540 service-hours at Three Square Food Bank to sort and pack food for needy individuals and families. In one afternoon, Citi employees sorted more than 80,000 pounds of perishable and non-perishable food items and packed 2,415 backpack meals for children who may otherwise go without food on the weekends.
tag-4: "We are proud to support this incredible organization, which does so much for individuals and families in need in Southern Nevada," said Diana Villanueva, Managing Director and President of Citi's Las Vegas site. "The Three Square team provides a vital safety net for those struggling to make ends meet, offering food and hope for those who may not have anywhere else to turn."
tag-5: Clark County, which comprises Las Vegas, North Las Vegas and Henderson, Nev., remains one of the hardest-hit areas in the country from the recent recession, with an unemployment rate of 14.3 percent, the highest foreclosure rate in the country, 14.6 percent of its citizens living in poverty and more than 6,000 homeless children in its school system.
tag-6: "We thank Citi for its incredible contribution to help Three Square provide assistance to even more of those in need," said Brian Burton, President and CEO of Three Square. "With so many Southern Nevadans facing the challenge of hunger, Citi's support is vital as we continue our work to ensure no one in our community goes hungry."
tag-7: Burton said that his organization had never hosted such a large group of volunteers – and that Citi volunteers "broke a record for the sheer volume of work that they completed."
tag-8: Citi's effort was part of the annual Chairman's Leadership Award (CLA). Citi Cards CEO Jud Linville and Rich Garside, Head of Global Consumer Operations & Technology at Citi, joined the Citi volunteers to sort incoming food donations and fill backpacks with meals for homeless and very low-income children in the Clark County School District.
tag-9: Citi has an ongoing relationship with Three Square through financial contributions and volunteer service in the "Summer Lunch League" for local children in need. Citi also selects the food bank for its annual Global Community Day volunteer service with a two-week food drive at The Lakes site and the sorting, packing and delivery of employee donations to Three Square in October.
tag-10: With the help of program partners like Citi, Three Square serves 110,000 men, women, children and seniors each month. During 2010, Three Square distributed more than 22 million pounds of food and grocery products in Southern Nevada. The facility has received national recognition as a model for meeting and eradicating hunger in the United States through its operational efficiency, excellent programming, community outreach, partnerships, delivery system and staff training. In addition to providing food to the hungry, Three Square also takes part in culinary training at its facility.
